artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Yamazakiya Seishichi; Carver: Tatekawa Hatsue
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 91; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 299.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: unassembled triptych: female figure in voluminous pants and sashes standing on platforms at L, looking down over subjects, emitting white beams from head; female figures in white and red with animal-like faces stand within beams in room below; male figure on stairs at C looks alert, PL hand on sword
markings: Carver’s seal R: 彫初 {hori Hatsu}| C, L: 立川彫初 {Tatekawa hori Hatsu} | Censor seal: 亥六改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: Miyamoto Musashi (C) and the evil fox Princess Osakabe 宮本無三四, 於佐壁之悪狐.
title: Miyamoto Musashi and the Exorcism of the Evil Fox of Princess Osakabe
